bwwExcerpt: Taking in the play is not easy. In addition to its length, many sequences are bizarre, didactic and choppy. But there is no denying its theatrical brilliance, literary ambition and cultural relevance. It is often just as romantic and hilarious as it is philosophic and intense.

"Kushnerâ€™s marathon magnum opus of contemporary American drama is now receiving a splashy, sleek and stunning Broadway revival with an outstanding cast led by Nathan Lane and Andrew Garfield...Taking in the play is not easy. In addition to its length, many sequences are bizarre, didactic and choppy. But there is no denying its theatrical brilliance, literary ambition and cultural relevance. It is often just as romantic and hilarious as it is philosophic and intense."
